intro: Dryandra seneciifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dryandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to Western Australia and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, leathery leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense, cylindrical inflorescences, which bloom during the warmer months. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in well-drained soils in open woodlands or heathlands. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
